    <div style="text-align: right;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">Exhibit 5.2</font><br>
    </div>
    <div style="text-align: right;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> <br>
      </font></div>
    <table style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="z7241bf6804ae4730b112851328714a01" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 13.7pt;"><img src="logo_polsinelli.jpg" height="64" width="234"></div>
            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 12pt; font-size: 8pt;">900 West 48th Place, Suite 900, Kansas City, Missouri, 64112&#160; &#8226;&#160; 816.753.1000</div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
    </div>
    <div style="text-align: justify; line-height: 11.4pt;">January 14, 2021</div>

    <div style="text-align: justify; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="line-height: 0pt;"><br style="line-height: 0pt;">
         </div>
      <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;">Board of Directors</div>
    </div>

    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;">T-Mobile&#160;US, Inc.</div>
      <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;">12920 SE 38th Street</div>
      <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;">Bellevue, Washington 98006</div>
    </div>

    <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;"><br style="line-height: 11.4pt;">
       </div>

    <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;">Ladies and Gentlemen:</div>

    <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">We have acted as special local counsel to those certain subsidiaries of T-Mobile US, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Parent</font>&#8221;), listed on <u>Schedule
        A</u> hereto (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Opinion Guarantors</font>&#8221;) in connection with the Underwriting Agreement dated as of January 11, 2021 (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Underwriting Agreement</font>&#8221;), by and among T-Mobile
      USA, Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">T-Mobile</font>&#8221;), the Parent, each of the subsidiary guarantors (together with the Parent, the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Guarantors</font>&#8221;) party thereto (including the&#160;Opinion
      Guarantors), and&#160;Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., relating to the issuance by T-Mobile of $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.250% Senior Notes due 2026 (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">2026 Notes</font>&#8221;), $1,000,000,000
      aggregate principal amount of T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.625% Senior Notes due 2029 (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">2029 Notes</font>&#8221;) and $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.875% Senior Notes due 2031 (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">2031 Notes</font>&#8221; and, together with the 2026 Notes and the 2029 Notes, the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</font>&#8221;). T-Mobile&#8217;s obligations under the Notes will be guaranteed (such guarantees, the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Guarantees</font>&#8221;)
      on a senior unsecured basis by the Guarantors (including the&#160;Opinion Guarantors). The Notes and the Guarantees are being offered pursuant to a prospectus supplement dated January 11, 2021 and the accompanying base prospectus dated September 28, 2020
      (such documents, collectively, the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Prospectus</font>&#8221;) that form part of the Parent&#8217;s registration statement on Form S-3ASR (File No. 333-249079) (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Registration Statement</font>&#8221;)
      filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on September 28, 2020, under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Securities Act</font>&#8221;). This opinion letter is furnished to you at your request to enable
      you to fulfill the requirements of Item 601(b)(5)&#160;of Regulation S-K, 17 C.F.R. &#167; 229.601(b)(5), in connection with the Registration Statement.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">For purposes of this opinion letter, we have examined copies of such agreements, instruments and documents as we have deemed an appropriate basis on which to render the opinions
      hereinafter expressed. In our examination of the aforesaid documents, we have assumed the genuineness of all signatures, the accuracy and completeness of all documents submitted to us, the authenticity of all original documents, and the conformity to
      authentic original documents of all documents submitted to us as copies (including electronic copies). We have also assumed the legal capacity for all purposes relevant hereto of all natural persons and, with respect to all parties to agreements or
      instruments relevant hereto other than the Opinion Guarantors, that such parties had the requisite power and authority (corporate or otherwise) to execute, deliver and perform such agreements or instruments, that such parties have duly authorized
      such agreements or instruments by all requisite action (corporate or otherwise), that such agreements or instruments have been duly executed and delivered by such parties and that such agreements or instruments are the valid, binding and enforceable
      obligations of all parties thereto. As to all matters of fact,&#160;we have relied on the representations and statements of fact made in the documents so reviewed, including all statements in certificates of public officials and officers of the Opinion
      Guarantors that we reviewed, and we have not independently established the facts so relied on. This opinion letter is given, and all statements herein are made, in the context of the foregoing.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">This opinion letter is based as to matters of law solely on the applicable provisions of the laws of the State of Georgia, the State of Kansas, the State of Missouri, the State of
      Nevada, the State of Texas and the Commonwealth of Virginia (but not including any laws, statutes, ordinances, administrative decisions, rules&#160;or regulations of any political subdivision below the state level), as currently in effect. We express no
      opinion herein as to any other statutes, rules&#160;or regulations (and in particular,&#160;we express no opinion as to any effect that such other statutes, rules&#160;or regulations may have on the opinions expressed herein).</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">Based upon, subject to and limited by the foregoing, we are of the opinion that:</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">1.<font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Each Opinion Guarantor is validly existing as a corporation or limited liability company, as applicable, under the laws of such
      Opinion Guarantor&#8217;s state of incorporation or organization, as the case may be, designated on <u>Schedule A</u> hereto (each, an &#8220;<font style="font-weight: bold;">Opinion Jurisdiction</font>&#8221;).</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">2.<font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Each Opinion Guarantor has the corporate or limited liability company power, as applicable, under the laws of its respective
      Opinion Jurisdiction to issue its Guarantee.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;"> <br>
       </div>

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">3.<font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Each Guarantee has been duly authorized by each Opinion Guarantor.</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;"> <br>
    </div>
    <br>
    <table style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; color: #000000;" id="z99f2742addf94d86a476769034d44fbd" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 100%; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: #000000 2px solid;">

    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">This opinion letter has been prepared for use in connection with the filing by the Parent of a Current Report on Form 8-K relating to the offering, sale and issuance of the Notes and the Guarantees.
      This opinion letter is given only as of the time of its delivery, and we assume no obligation or responsibility to update or supplement this opinion letter after its delivery.</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>

    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">We hereby consent to the filing of this opinion letter as Exhibit&#160;5.2 to the above-described Form 8-K and to the reference to this firm under the caption &#8220;Legal Matters&#8221; in the Prospectus. In
        giving this consent,&#160;we do not thereby admit that we are an &#8220;expert&#8221; within the meaning of the Securities Act.</div>

            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>
            </div>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 32.44%; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 11.4pt;">Nevada</div>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td style="width: 67.56%; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 11.4pt;">USST of Texas, Inc.</div>
            <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 11.4pt;"> <br>

<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; color: #000000;">
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; text-align: right;"><font style="font-weight: bold;"> </font>
    <hr noshade="noshade" align="center" style="height: 4px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; text-align: center; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border: none;"></div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; text-align: right;"><font style="font-weight: bold;">Exhibit 5.3</font><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-size: 12pt;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><img width="149" border="0" height="54" src="logo_mclanemiddleton.jpg"></font></div>
  <div style="text-align: right; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">January 14, 2021</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Board of Directors</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">T-Mobile US, Inc.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">12920 SE 38th Street</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Bellevue, Washington 98006</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;" class="DSPFListTable" id="ze4fe0f6bf6c14f38bb44eb53e3159a32">

      <tr>
        <td style="width: 31.5pt;"><br>
        </td>
        <td style="width: 40.5pt; vertical-align: top; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Re:</td>
        <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
          <div style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"><u>Registration Statement on Form S-3</u></div>
        </td>
      </tr>

  </table>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Ladies and Gentlemen:</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">This firm acts as special local counsel to Sprint Communications Company of New Hampshire, Inc., a New Hampshire corporation (the &#8220;Opinion Guarantor&#8221;), a
    subsidiary of T-Mobile US, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#8220;Parent&#8221;), in connection with the Registration Statement on Form S-3 (File No. 333-249079) (the &#8220;Registration Statement&#8221;), filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the
    Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;) by the Parent, T-Mobile USA, Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#8220;T-Mobile&#8221;), and certain subsidiaries of T-Mobile (including the Opinion Guarantor), with respect to the issuance of (i) $1,000,000,000
    aggregate principal amount of T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.250% Senior Notes due 2026 (the &#8220;2026 Notes&#8221;), $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.625% Senior Notes due 2029 (the &#8220;2029 Notes&#8221;) and $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of
    T-Mobile&#8217;s 2.875% Senior Notes due 2031 (the &#8220;2031 Notes&#8221; and, together with the 2026 Notes and the 2029 Notes, the &#8220;Notes&#8221;) and (ii) the guarantees of the Notes on a senior unsecured basis by Parent and certain of the T-Mobile&#8217;s wholly-owned
    subsidiaries (collectively with Parent, the &#8220;Guarantors&#8221;), including the Opinion Guarantor (the guarantees of the Opinion Guarantor, the &#8220;Note Guarantees&#8221;). The Notes and the Guarantees are being offered pursuant to a prospectus supplement dated
    January 11, 2021 and the accompanying base prospectus dated September 28, 2020 (such documents, collectively, the &#8220;Prospectus&#8221;) that form part of the Registration Statement.&#160; This opinion letter is furnished to you at your request to enable you to
    fulfill the requirements of Item 601(b)(5) of Regulation S-K, 17 C.F.R. &#167; 229.601(b)(5), in connection with the Registration Statement.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">In preparation of this opinion we have examined the following documents:</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">1.&#160; the Articles of Incorporation of the Opinion Guarantor;</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">2.&#160; the Bylaws of the Opinion Guarantor;</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="text-align: right; text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;"><a name="z_iDocIDField45adb6df-12fd-4e11-a5db-e8be"></a>McLane Middleton, Professional Association</div>
      <div style="text-align: right; text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt;">Manchester, Concord, Portsmouth, NH | Woburn, Boston, MA</div>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="line-height: 11.4pt;"><br style="line-height: 11.4pt;">
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 14.4pt;">
      <div style="text-align: right; text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 11.4pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">McLane.com</div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
    <div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
      <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
  </div>
  January 14, 2021
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Page 2</div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-size: 12pt;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
    </font></div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">3.&#160; a certificate of the Opinion Guarantor&#8217;s existence from the New Hampshire Secretary of State dated January 8, 2021;</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">4.&#160; the Omnibus Unanimous Written Consent of the Board of Directors, Sole Member, or Managing Member, Manager or General Partner or General Partners, as
    Applicable, In Lieu of Meeting, dated January 10, 2021; and</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">5.&#160; such other documents and items as we deemed necessary for the purposes of this opinion.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">We have assumed without independent verification that the information furnished by the Opinion Guarantor is accurate.&#160; We have not conducted any independent
    outside review of agreements, contracts, indentures, instruments, orders, judgments, rules, regulations, writs, injunctions, or decrees by which the Opinion Guarantor or any of its property may be bound nor, except as noted above, have we made any
    outside independent investigation as to the existence of actions, suits, investigations, or proceedings, if any, pending or threatened against the Opinion Guarantor.&#160; We have not reviewed the financial books or records of the Company (or any of its
    subsidiaries) and, unless expressly stated, do not express any opinion as to financial or tax matters or compliance with tax laws.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">For purposes of this opinion letter, we have examined copies of such agreements, instruments, and documents as we have deemed an appropriate basis on which
    to render the opinions hereinafter expressed. In our examination of the aforesaid documents, we have assumed the genuineness of all signatures, the accuracy and completeness of all documents submitted to us, the authenticity of all original documents,
    and the conformity to authentic original documents of all documents submitted to us as copies (including electronic copies). We have also assumed the legal capacity of all natural persons and, with respect to all parties to agreements or instruments
    other than the Opinion Guarantor, that such parties had the requisite power and authority (corporate or otherwise) to execute, deliver, and perform such agreements or instruments, that such parties have duly authorized such agreements or instruments by
    all requisite action (corporate or otherwise), that such agreements or instruments have been executed, and delivered by such parties, and that such agreements or instruments are the valid, binding, and enforceable obligations of all parties thereto. As
    to all matters of fact, we have relied on the representations and statements of fact made in the documents so reviewed, including all statements in certificates of public officials and officers of the Opinion Guarantor that we reviewed, and we have not
    independently established the facts we relied on. This opinion letter is given, and all statements herein are made, in the context of the foregoing.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">We are members of the Bar of the State of New Hampshire, and we express no opinion as to matters involving the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State
    of New Hampshire.&#160; This opinion is limited to the effect of the laws (including administrative and judicial interpretations) of the State of New Hampshire as they existed on the date of this letter and to the facts bearing upon the opinions below as
    they existed on the date of this letter, and we expressly disclaim any obligation or undertaking to update or modify the opinions below as a consequence of any future changes in the laws or in the facts bearing upon those opinions.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
    <div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
      <hr noshade="noshade" style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;"></div>
  </div>
  January 14, 2021
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Page 3</div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-size: 12pt;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;"><br>
    </font></div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Based on the foregoing, we are of the opinion that:</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt;"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">1.</font><font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">The
      Opinion Guarantor is validly existing as a corporation under the laws of the State of New Hampshire.</font></div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt;"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">2.</font><font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">The
      Opinion Guarantor has the corporate power under the laws of the State of New Hampshire to issue the Note Guarantees.</font></div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt;"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">3.</font><font style="text-indent: 0px;" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">The
      Note Guarantees to which the Opinion Guarantor is a party have been duly authorized by the Opinion Guarantor.</font></div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">This opinion letter has been prepared for use in connection with the filing by the Parent of a Current Report on Form 8-K relating to the offering, sale and
    issuance of the Notes and the Guarantees.&#160; Please note that we are opining only as to matters set forth herein, and no opinion should be inferred as to any other matters.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>
  <div style="text-indent: 36pt; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">We hereby consent to the filing of this opinion letter as Exhibit 5.3 to the above-described Form 8-K and to the reference to this firm under the caption
    &#8220;Legal Matters&#8221; in the Prospectus. In giving this consent, we do not admit that we are an &#8220;expert&#8221; within the meaning of the Securities Act.</div>
  <div style="line-height: 13.7pt;"><br style="line-height: 13.7pt;">
  </div>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 99.1
<TEXT>
<html>
  <head>
    <title></title>
    <!-- Licensed to: Broadridge Finanicial Soultions, Inc.
         Document created using EDGARfilings PROfile 7.3.2.0
         Copyright 1995 - 2021 Broadridge -->
  </head>
<body style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; color: #000000;" bgcolor="#ffffff">


  <div>
    <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 13.7pt; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: bold;">
      <hr style="height: 4px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border: none;" align="center" noshade="noshade"></div>
    <div style="text-align: right; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: bold;"> <font style="font-size: 10pt;">Exhibit 99.1<br>
      </font></div>
    <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">T-Mobile Announces Proposed Public Offering of Senior Notes</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">January 11, 2021</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">BELLEVUE, Wash.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) (&#8220;T-Mobile&#8221;) announced today that T-Mobile USA, Inc., its
      direct wholly-owned subsidiary (&#8220;T-Mobile USA&#8221; or the &#8220;Issuer&#8221;), plans to offer, subject to market and other conditions, up to $2.0 billion aggregate principal amount of senior notes, to be issued in three tranches with maturities in 2026, 2029 and
      2031 (collectively, the &#8220;notes&#8221;) in a registered public offering.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">T-Mobile USA intends to use the net proceeds from the offering of the notes for general corporate purposes, which may include
      among other things, financing acquisitions of additional spectrum and refinancing existing indebtedness on an ongoing basis.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., Citigroup Global Markets Inc., Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, Goldman Sachs &amp; Co. LLC,
      Barclays Capital Inc., J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Morgan Stanley &amp; Co. LLC and RBC Capital Markets, LLC are the joint book-running managers for the offering of the notes.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">The Issuer has filed a registration statement (including a prospectus) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) for
      the offering of notes to which this communication relates. Before you invest, you should read the prospectus in that registration statement and the related prospectus supplement and other documents the Issuer will file with the SEC for more complete
      information about the Issuer and the offering of notes. You may get these documents for free by visiting EDGAR on the SEC Web site at http://www.sec.gov. Alternatively, the Issuer, any underwriter or any dealer participating in the notes offering
      will arrange to send you the prospectus and related prospectus supplement if you request it by contacting Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., Attention: Prospectus Group, 60 Wall Street, New York, New York 10005-2836, by telephone at (800) 503-4611 or by
      email at prospectus.cpdg@db.com; Citigroup, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, 1155 Long Island Avenue, Edgewood, NY 11717, or by phone at (800) 831- 9146; Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, Attn: Prospectus Department, 6933 Louis Stephens Drive,
      Morrisville, North Carolina 27560, 1-800-221-1037, usa.prospectus@credit-suisse.com; Goldman Sachs &amp; Co. LLC, 200 West Street, New York, New York 10282, Attn: Prospectus Department, Telephone 212-902-1171, Email: prospectus-ny@ny.email.gs.com;
      Barclays Capital Inc., c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, 1155 Long Island Avenue, Edgewood, NY 11717, barclaysprospectus@broadridge.com, (888) 603-5847; J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, 1155 Long Island Avenue,
      Edgewood, NY 11717, Phone: 631-254-1735; Morgan Stanley &amp; Co. LLC, Attention: Prospectus Department, 180 Varick Street, Second Floor, New York, New York 10014 or RBC Capital Markets, LLC, 200 Vesey Street, 8th Floor New York, New York 10281,
      Attention: Leveraged Capital Markets; by telephone at 1-877-280-1299.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">This press release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy the notes or
      any other securities, nor shall it constitute an offer, solicitation or sale in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale is unlawful.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div id="DSPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div id="DSPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr style="border-width: 0px; clear: both; margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000;" noshade="noshade"></div>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-Looking Statements</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-style: italic;">This press release contains forward-looking statements that are based on T-Mobile management&#8217;s current
      expectations. Such statements include, without limitation, statements regarding the planned offering of the notes and statements regarding the intended use of proceeds from the offering of the notes. Such forward-looking statements are subject to
      certain risks, uncertainties and assumptions, including, without limitation, prevailing market conditions and other factors. Should one or more of these risks or uncertainties materialize, or should underlying assumptions prove incorrect, actual
      results may vary materially from those expected. More information about potential risk factors that could affect T-Mobile and its results is included in T-Mobile&#8217;s filings with the SEC, which are available at http://www.sec.gov.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 99.2
<TEXT>
<html>
  <head>
    <title></title>
    <!-- Licensed to: Broadridge Finanicial Soultions, Inc.
         Document created using EDGARfilings PROfile 7.3.2.0
         Copyright 1995 - 2021 Broadridge -->

<body style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left; color: #000000;" bgcolor="#ffffff">


  <div>
    <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">
      <hr style="height: 4px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border: none;" align="center" noshade="noshade"></div>
    <div style="text-align: right; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> Exhibit 99.2<br>
    </div>
    <div style="text-align: center; line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">T-Mobile Agrees to Sell $3.0 Billion of Senior Notes</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">January 11, 2021</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">BELLEVUE, Wash.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ: TMUS) (&#8220;T-Mobile&#8221;) announced today that T-Mobile USA, Inc., its
      direct wholly-owned subsidiary (&#8220;T-Mobile USA&#8221; or the &#8220;Issuer&#8221;), has agreed to sell $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 2.250% Senior Notes due 2026 (the &#8220;2026 notes&#8221;), $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 2.625% Senior Notes due
      2029 (the &#8220;2029 notes&#8221;) and $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 2.875% Senior Notes due 2031 (the &#8220;2031 notes&#8221; and together with the 2026 notes and the 2029 notes, the &#8220;notes&#8221;) in a registered public offering. The offering of the notes is
      scheduled to close on January 14, 2021, subject to satisfaction of customary closing conditions.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">T-Mobile USA intends to use the net proceeds from the offering of the notes for general corporate purposes, which may include
      among other things, financing acquisitions of additional spectrum and refinancing existing indebtedness on an ongoing basis.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., Citigroup Global Markets Inc., Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, Goldman Sachs &amp; Co. LLC,
      Barclays Capital Inc., J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Morgan Stanley &amp; Co. LLC and RBC Capital Markets, LLC are the joint book-running managers for the offering of the notes. Academy Securities, Inc., C.L. King &amp; Associates, Inc., Great Pacific
      Securities and Mischler Financial Group, Inc. are acting as co-managers.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif;">The Issuer has filed a registration statement (including a prospectus) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) for
      the offering of notes to which this communication relates. Before you invest, you should read the prospectus in that registration statement and the related prospectus supplement and other documents the Issuer will file with the SEC for more complete
      information about the Issuer and the offering of the notes. You may get these documents for free by visiting EDGAR on the SEC Web site at http://www.sec.gov. Alternatively, the Issuer, any underwriter or any dealer participating in the offering of
      the notes will arrange to send you the prospectus and related prospectus supplement if you request it by contacting Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., Attention: Prospectus Group, 60 Wall Street, New York, New York 10005-2836, by telephone at (800)
      503-4611 or by email at prospectus.cpdg@db.com; Citigroup, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, 1155 Long Island Avenue, Edgewood, NY 11717, or by phone at (800) 831- 9146; Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, Attn: Prospectus Department, 6933 Louis
      Stephens Drive, Morrisville, North Carolina 27560, 1-800-221-1037, usa.prospectus@credit-suisse.com; Goldman Sachs &amp; Co. LLC, 200 West Street, New York, New York 10282, Attn: Prospectus Department, Telephone 212-902-1171, Email:
      prospectus-ny@ny.email.gs.com; Barclays Capital Inc., c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, 1155 Long Island Avenue, Edgewood, NY 11717, barclaysprospectus@broadridge.com, (888) 603-5847; J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions,
      1155 Long Island Avenue, Edgewood, NY 11717, Phone: 631-254-1735; Morgan Stanley &amp; Co. LLC, Attention: Prospectus Department, 180 Varick Street, Second Floor, New York, New York 10014 or RBC Capital Markets, LLC, 200 Vesey Street, 8th Floor New
      York, New York 10281, Attention: Leveraged Capital Markets; by telephone at 1-877-280-1299.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> <br>
    </div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;">This press release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy the notes or
      any other securities, nor shall it constitute an offer, solicitation or sale in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale is unlawful.</div>
    <div style="line-height: 13.7pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif; font-weight: bold;"> <br>

      subject to certain risks, uncertainties and assumptions, including, without limitation, prevailing market conditions, difficulties in executing the offering of the notes and other factors. Should one or more of these risks or uncertainties

// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
